Cutting off means the meaning of removing and eliminating. Indulging in play means the five kinds of desires and various enjoyments.
Sentient beings indulge in play here, and this is how they should be cut off. This is called the sounds of cutting off defilements and indulging in play.
The sound of the arising of conditioned phenomena means that all phenomena are characterized by selflessness, moment-by-moment arising and ceasing, and the characteristic of quiescence.
As for the characteristic of selflessness, the form aggregate is impermanent, and so are the other aggregates up to consciousness. This is called the characteristic of selflessness.
As for moment-by-moment arising and ceasing, all conditioned phenomena arise moment by moment. What arises must cease. This is called the arising and ceasing of all phenomena moment by moment.
As for quiescence, it is empty and without location, without form, without substance, and equal to space. This is called the characteristic of quiescence.
The impermanence of the past, future, and present is called the sound of the arising of conditioned phenomena.

The sound of the characteristics of defilement by the three realms of existence means that the characteristics are the characteristics of the desire realm, which are the five desires and various sensual pleasures, the characteristics of the form realm, which are the defilements of form, and the characteristics of the formless realm, which are the defilements of the formless. These are called characteristics.
The three realms of existence are the realm of desire, the realm of form, and the formless realm.
What is the realm of desire?
From the hells up to the heaven of freely partaking of others' creations.
What is existence in the form realm?
From the Brahma realm up to the peak of existence.
What is existence in the formless realm?
From the sphere of infinite space up to the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.
Being attached to the three realms and the ninety-eight kinds of defilements, this is called the sound of the characteristics of being tainted by the three existences.
The sound of arising afflictions refers to the three kinds of seeking:
seeking desire, seeking existence, and seeking pure conduct.
Seeking desire means seeking form, sound, smell, taste, and touch.
What is seeking form?
Form is of two kinds: one is form, the other is shape.
Form is of twelve kinds, namely blue, yellow, red, white, smoke, clouds, dust, mist, light, shadow, brightness, and darkness.
Shape is of eight kinds, namely long, short, square, round, high, low, flat, and uneven. This is called desire and form.
What is the sound of desire?
Sounds have seven types, namely conch sounds, drum sounds, small drum sounds, large drum sounds, singing sounds, male sounds, and female sounds. These are called sounds of desire.
What are the fragrances of desire?

Fragrances have seven types, namely root fragrances, heart fragrances, bark fragrances, sugar fragrances, leaf fragrances, flower fragrances, and fruit fragrances, or male fragrances and female fragrances. These are called fragrances of desire.
What are the flavors of desire?

Flavors have seven types, namely sweet flavors, sour flavors, salty flavors, bitter flavors, astringent flavors, bland flavors, and spicy flavors, or male flavors and female flavors. These are called flavors of desire.
What are the tactile sensations of desire?

Tactile sensations have eight types, namely cold, hot, light, heavy, rough, smooth, hunger, and thirst, or male tactile sensations and female tactile sensations. These are called tactile sensations of desire. These are called desires.
What is the pursuit of existence?
Existence refers to the existence of desire, the existence of form, and the existence of the formless. This is called the pursuit of existence.
What is the pursuit of pure conduct?
Renouncing the world and practicing austerities, wishing to attain the heavens or wishing to attain nirvana, this is called the sound of seeking the holy life.
What is the meaning of seeking?
It means the meaning of being attached to pleasure.
What is the sound of arising faults?
The various existences of sentient beings are all called faults. Except for the heavens and nirvana, seeking all existences elsewhere is faulty. This is called the sound of arising faults.
The sound of the supremacy of the holy path refers to the eightfold right path.
Right view up to right concentration are without faults and without attachment, therefore it is called the holy path.
This is called the sound of the supremacy of the holy path.
The sound of grasping means grasping onto dharmas. This is called the sound of grasping.
The sound of transformation birth refers to the four skandhas of feeling, perception, mental formations, and consciousness. This is called transformation birth.
It is also said that there are womb birth, egg birth, moisture birth, and transformation birth.
Womb birth is of four kinds: in the east in Uttarakuru, in the south in JambudvÄ«pa, in the west in GodÄnÄ«ya, and in the north in Kuru.
All birds are born from eggs.
Mosquitoes, flies, and lice are born from moisture.
All gods are born spontaneously. This is called the sound of spontaneous birth.
The sound of no ownership means that all dharmas are not owned by anyone, because they arise without a self.
No ownership means no pride in ownership. This is called the sound of no ownership.
The sound of complete cessation means that because of the cessation of ignorance, karmic formations cease, and so on, up to the cessation of birth, sorrow, lamentation, pain, and distress cease.
Complete cessation means nirvana, quiescence, and no further rebirth. This is called the sound of complete cessation.
The sound of transcending karmic retribution means the three karmas, namely, the three of the body, the four of the speech, and the three of the mind.
Karmic retribution means the purification of the three karmas. This is called the sound of transcending karmic retribution.
The sound of all dharmas being equal to space means that all dharmas are equal to space.
How are they equal to space?

All dharmas are only names and only conceptual, without characteristics, without discrimination, without substance, motionless, unshakable, inconceivable, unborn and unceasing, without action in accordance with signlessness, without creation and without appearance, without form and without locus, equal to space and abiding in equality.
Not old, not dead, without sorrow, lamentation, pain, and distress.
Form is equal to space, feeling, perception, mental formations, and consciousness are also like this.
The past has already ceased, the future has not yet come, and the present does not remain - this is called the sound of dharmas equal to space.
The sound of the profound Dharma means ignorance as a condition for formations, up to birth as a condition for old age, death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, and distress.
When ignorance ceases, formations cease, up to when birth ceases, sorrow, lamentation, pain, and distress cease.
That principle is true, and this is called profound.

Profound refers to the twelve links of dependent arising, where all verbal expressions are cut off, without boundaries, without location, without time, cutting off the individual, cutting off the nature of the world, entering equality, and breaking through the grasping of self and other. This is called the sound of the profound Dharma.
Eliminating the sounds of solidity, heaviness, ignorance, delusion, darkness, and obscurity.
Solidity refers to the five views such as the view of the self;
heaviness refers to the five aggregates;

ignorance refers to not knowing the past and future, as well as what is blameworthy and what is not, not recognizing the Buddha, Dharma, and Sangha, not knowing generosity, precepts, and heaven, not knowing the aggregates, realms, and sense bases. This is called ignorance.
Delusion refers to the loss of mindfulness and awareness. This is called delusion.
Darkness refers to the suffering of entering the womb, all that is impure, yet giving rise to pleasant feelings and confusion about the past and future. This is called darkness.
Obscurity refers to being without knowledge in the three times, without skillful means, and unclear. This is called obscurity.

Elimination means the light of revealing the truth, eliminating one's own fruits, eliminating afflictions, eliminating non-afflictions, eliminating remaining habits, entering the inconceivable state of equality and supremacy. This is called the meaning of elimination.
This is called eliminating solidity, heaviness, ignorance, stupidity, and darkness.
The sound of knowing in advance refers to the eight kinds of knowing in advance, namely right view up to right concentration. This is called the bodhisattva's knowing in advance.
Eliminating the five views is called right view;
Not thinking of greed, anger, or delusion is called right thought;
Purity of physical and mental actions is called right action;
Purity of verbal action is called right speech;
Deceiving, flattering, pretending to have few desires, seeking profit with profit, and the five kinds of selling:
Selling alcohol, selling meat, selling poison, selling swords, and selling women, excluding these evil actions is called right livelihood;
Good physical and mental actions are called right effort;
Mindfulness of the four establishments of mindfulness is called right mindfulness;
With a concentrated mind, free from defilement, with the characteristics of tranquility, cessation, and emptiness, this is called right concentration;
This is called the sound of knowing the practice in advance.
The sound of the four noble truths refers to the truths of suffering, origination, cessation, and the path.
What is the truth of suffering?
It can eliminate the ten defilements.
What is the truth of origination?
It can eliminate the seven defilements.
What is the truth of cessation?
It can eliminate the seven defilements.
What is the truth of the path?
It can eliminate the eight defilements and the four contemplations, and even eliminate the bonds of the form and formless realms.
This is called the sound of the four noble truths.

The sound of cutting off desire and defilement means that desire is attachment to pleasure and lack of disgust, desire for adornment and attachment to beauty, thinking of desire, thinking of touch, and waiting to become intimate.

Defilement means bondage, pleasure means delighting in the six sense objects, not being disgusted means single-mindedly attached to conditions without any other thoughts, desire means joy, adornment means for the sake of defiled thoughts, attachment means playing, coquettishness means making various appearances, contemplating desire means attachment to the five desires, contemplating touch means wanting to be intimate with each other.
Waiting means attracting each other with incense and flowers, being intimate means the defiled mind becoming increasingly indulgent.
Cutting off means completely removing the previous unwholesome dharmas, this is called the sound of cutting off desire and defilement.
The sound of transcending old age and death - old age refers to the physical body deteriorating, leaning on a cane and walking slowly, the faculties decaying, this is called old age;
death refers to the faculties breaking down.
Why is it called death?
Seeking another place to receive birth, when that karma ripens, this is called death.
How is old age and death distinguished?
The faculties maturing is called old age, the faculties breaking down is called death, first old age and then death is called old age and death.
To transcend this old age and death, this is called transcendence.
What is the meaning of transcendence?
The meaning of surpassing, reaching the other shore, being free, and not being reborn again, this is called the sound of transcending old age and death.
The sound of subduing evil speech means subduing speech and subduing the body.
How does one subdue speech?
Using similar speech to refute dissimilar speech, using dissimilar speech to refute similar speech;
Using true speech to subdue false speech, using false speech to subdue true speech;
Using non-speech to subdue speech, using speech to subdue non-speech;ğŸ”½Using the ultimate truth to subdue non-ultimate truth, using non-ultimate truth to subdue ultimate truth;
Using definitive speech to subdue indefinite speech, using indefinite speech to subdue definitive speech;
Using one to subdue many, using many to subdue one;
Using non-offense to subdue offense, using offense to subdue non-offense;

Using the presently realized to subdue what is not presently realized, using what is not presently realized to subdue the presently realized;ğŸ”½Using what is lost to subdue what is not lost, using what is not lost to subdue what is lost;
Using what is not of a kind to subdue what is not of a kind.
Evil means speaking what is untrue, what is not true, what is not discrimination.
Subduing means the meaning of cutting off, the meaning of blocking, the meaning of covering, this is called subduing evil speech and sounds.
The sound of speaking and abiding means speaking, making clear, revealing, discriminating and explaining, not obscuring the path, speaking in accordance with the Dharma, this is called speaking;

Abiding means placing in one place, speaking of nirvana, speaking of transcending the world, praising what is said, speaking with no characteristics, speaking with no appearance, speaking without difference, speaking without action, speaking of enlightenment, speaking of emptiness, speaking of tranquility, this is called the sound of speaking and abiding.
The sound of speaking of severing bonds means the cessation of ignorance up to the cessation of old age and death, the cessation of all aggregates.
Cessation means loss, submergence, cutting off, and non-arising, this is called cessation.
Cutting off means cutting off all the fetters, cutting off the roots of afflictions without leaving any remainder, this is called the sound of severing bonds.
The sound of placing an answer means answering according to the question, distinguishing the answer, asking back, and placing the answer.
What is answering according to the question?
Answering just as the question is asked.
What is distinguishing the answer?
Distinguishing extensively according to what is asked.
What is asking back?
If someone asks a question, asking back to make them answer.
What is placing the answer?
Like asking about my self being cut off or permanent, placing it and not answering, with a distinguishing question asking, answering according to the question;
with a questioning question asking, distinguishing the answer;ğŸ”½with a placing answer question asking, asking back;
with an answering according to the question question asking, placing the answer;
This is called the sound of setting aside the answer.
The sound of subduing the thieves of demons refers to the four demons of form, feeling, perception, impulse, and consciousness, which are the thieves of the aggregates.
From this existence to the other shore, ceasing all affairs, this is the thieves of the demon of death.
Ignorance, craving, and grasping are the thieves of the demon of afflictions.
The five desires and various enjoyments are the body of the heavenly demon, which are the thieves of the heavenly demon.
This is called the sound of subduing the thieves of demons.
The sound of extinguishing all realms means extinguishing form up to extinguishing touch.
The realms refer to form, sound, smell, taste, and touch, which is called the sound of extinguishing all realms.
The sound of eliminating all afflictions means cutting off and extinguishing afflictions.
Eliminating afflictions means that for the great poison of lustful desire, the antidote is the contemplation of impurity;
for the great poison of anger, the antidote is compassion;
The great poison of ignorance is cured by the contemplation of the twelve links of dependent origination. This is called the sound of eliminating afflictions.

The sound of non-differentiation and non-destruction means non-differentiation, non-destruction, the ultimate truth, reality, emptiness, signlessness, formlessness, equality, imperturbability, and inconceivability. This is called non-differentiation.

Non-destruction means non-differentiation in form, equality, signlessness, imperturbability, non-destruction, non-severance, purity, freedom from harm, non-conceptuality, and absence of sequence. This is called the sound of non-differentiation and non-destruction.

The sound of courageous strength, speed, and fearlessness means courage is diligence, strength is the ten powers, speed is swiftness, and fearlessness is being unafraid in all situations. This is called the sound of courageous strength, speed, and fearlessness.
The sound of giving peace and protection means
giving is of two kinds:
inner giving and outer giving.
What is inner giving?
Expounding the true four noble truths.
What is external giving?
Giving flesh, skin, blood, country, city, wife, children, wealth, grain, and so forth.
Tranquility is of three kinds: bodily, verbal, and mental.
What is bodily tranquility?
Not committing the three faults;
Verbal tranquility is being free from the four verbal faults;
Mental tranquility is being free from greed, hatred, and delusion.
Guarding is guarding the six sense faculties.
Peace is living together harmoniously, not seeking others' faults, being content, having few desires, and not seeking to extend or shorten [anything].
Not seeking others' faults means not looking for faults in others, not using this to speak ill of that, this is called the sound of giving, tranquility, guarding, and peace.
The sound of the seven riches of the noble ones refers to faith, shame, conscience, giving, precepts, learning, and wisdom. These are called the sound of the seven riches of the noble ones.
The sound of distinguishing name and form means the four aggregates are name, and the four elements are form.
Distinguishing means distinguishing name and form, this is called the sound of distinguishing name and form.
The sound of ultimate meaning means distinguishing the five aggregates, this is called the sound of ultimate meaning.

The sound of attaining the fruit of realization means the four fruits: from stream-entry to arhatship and pratyekabuddhahood. Attaining means entering the meaning, realizing means directly realizing, making means creating, this is called the sound of attaining the fruit of realization.
The sound of liberation from bondage means the three bonds:
greed, hatred, and delusion.
Liberation means being free from these three bonds, this is called the sound of liberation from bondage.

The sound of giving rise to the three existences means the existence of birth, the existence of the present, and the existence of the future, this is called the sound of giving rise to the three existences.

The sound of cutting off arrogance and pride means that arrogance refers to arrogance of appearance, arrogance of vigor, arrogance of wealth, arrogance of power, arrogance of family, arrogance of practicing goodness, arrogance of longevity, and arrogance of intelligence. These are called the eight arrogances.
Pride refers to the seven kinds of pride: pride, great pride, excessive pride, pride of self, pride of inferiority, pride of superiority, and false pride. These are called the seven kinds of pride.
Cutting off means cutting off arrogance and pride. This is called the sound of cutting off arrogance and pride.
The sound of penetrating all dharmas means penetrating means knowing according to the realm.
All dharmas refers to wholesome and unwholesome dharmas.
The five desires and various enjoyments are called unwholesome dharmas. Cutting off the five desires is called wholesome dharmas. This is called the sound of penetrating all dharmas.
The sound of discriminating according to the Dharma means that such means the meaning of equality, and the Dharma refers to wholesome and unwholesome dharmas.
Unwholesome dharmas means not cutting off the five desires and various enjoyments;
wholesome dharmas means cutting off the five desires and various enjoyments.
Cutting off means destroying, which refers to the sounds of correct discrimination.
Sounds of pleasure, displeasure, and ultimate truth - pleasure refers to the five sense objects;
displeasure refers to not being attached to the five desires;
ultimate truth refers to emptiness and signlessness;
this is called the sounds of pleasure, displeasure, and ultimate truth.
Sounds of cutting off craving - craving refers to craving for form up to craving for touch;
cutting off means eliminating;
this is called the sounds of cutting off craving.
Sounds of the supreme vehicle - this refers to the three vehicles:
the Buddha vehicle, the pratyekabuddha vehicle, and the Å›rÄvaka vehicle;
prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ and the ten grounds, this is called the Buddha vehicle.
Taming one's own body, calming one's own body, causing one's own body to enter nirvÄá¹‡a, this is called the pratyekabuddha vehicle.
Beings with dull faculties, fearful beings, wishing to escape from birth and death, this is called the Å›rÄvaka vehicle.
This is called the sounds of the supreme vehicle.
The sounds of faith, diligence, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom means to contemplate without deviating from the thoughts of faith;
to be courageous, diligent, and uphold the practices is called diligence;
to single-mindedly focus the mind is called mindfulness;
to be unmoved by things is called concentration;
to be pure and impartial in prajÃ±Ä is called wisdom;
these are called the sounds of faith, diligence, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom.
The sounds of subduing the six sense faculties and not being ignorant of the six supernormal powers means the six sense faculties are the eye faculty up to the mind faculty;
subduing means subduing forms up to subduing dharmas;
the six supernormal powers are the divine eye, divine ear, knowledge of others' minds, knowledge of past lives, spiritual powers, and knowledge of the destruction of defilements.
Ignorant means ignorance, not being ignorant means eliminating that ignorance.
This is called the sounds of subduing the six sense faculties and not being ignorant of the six supernormal powers.
The sound of the realization of omniscience means that the omniscient one knows all worldly dharmas.
World means the momentary arising and ceasing.
Furthermore, world refers to the aggregates, sense bases, and elements.
Furthermore, world is of two kinds:
one is the world of sentient beings, and the other is the world of activities.
The world of sentient beings refers to all sentient beings.
The world of activities refers to the abodes of sentient beings, all worlds can be known and are known.
Wisdom is of two kinds:
the wisdom of the Å›rÄvakas and omniscience, this is called the realization of wisdom.
Realizing one's own body and realizing the bodies of others, this is called the sound of the realization of omniscience.
The sound of killing afflictions means that killing has the meaning of eliminating and cutting off;
afflictions refers to the ninety-eight kinds of latent tendencies.

In the desire realm, there are ten latent tendencies eliminated by the truth of suffering, seven eliminated by the truth of accumulation, eight eliminated by the truth of the path, and four eliminated by the truth of cessation;

In the form realm, there are nine proclivities to be eliminated by the path of cultivation of the truth of suffering, six proclivities to be eliminated by the path of cultivation of the truth of origination, seven proclivities to be eliminated by the path of cultivation of the truth of cessation, and three proclivities to be eliminated by the path of cultivation of the truth of the path.
The formless realm is also like this.
Correct means clearly eliminating and cutting off without any remaining defilements.
This is called the sound of correctly killing afflictions.
The last syllable, beyond which this dharma cannot be spoken of, means if there are no syllables, this is called nirvana;
if there are syllables, then it is saá¹ƒsÄra.
Last means there are no more syllables, except for the syllable ra.
Cannot be spoken of means cannot be obtained, cannot be discriminated, and cannot be spoken of because it is formless.
All dharmas refers to the aggregates, sense bases, and sense fields, as well as the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment.
This is called the last syllable, beyond which it cannot be spoken of.
